abstract: Background: Increasing numbers of variables in surveys and administrative databases are created. Principal component analysis (PCA) is important to summarize data or reduce dimensionality. However, one disadvantage of using PCA is the interpretability of the principal components (PCs), especially in a high-dimensional database. By analyzing the variance distribution according to PCA loadings and approximating PCs with input variables, we aim to demonstrate the importance of variables based on the proportions of total variances contributed or explained by input variables.
article_title: Principal Component Approximation and Interpretation in Health Survey and Biobank Data

affiliation.original_name: Centre de Recherche du Centre Hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal, Université de Montréal, Canada
